definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: First-time students will get one apron (one size) for free.
sentences.chinese: 第一次參加神風小廚師課程的學生可獲贈圍裙一條。

sentences.english: And he tugged at her apron and the hands.
sentences.chinese: 他使勁拉她的圍裙和手。

sentences.english: The soldier made the white dog sit on the apron and opened up the box.
sentences.chinese: 士兵把白狗弄到了圍裙上，打開了箱子。

sentences.english: Maids in white aprons, Say the bells at St. Catherine 's.
sentences.chinese: 提到穿白圍裙的女士們，就數大鐘聖凱薩林。

sentences.english: She looked at him, and smoothed out her apron with one hand.
sentences.chinese: 她看着他，用一隻手把圍裙弄平。

sentences.english: I had just fastened our pinafores together, and hung them up for a curtain, when in comes Joseph, on an errand from the stables.
sentences.chinese: 我把我們的圍裙系在一起，掛起來當窗簾用。

sentences.english: Charlotte uttered a scream, and hid her face in her apron.
sentences.chinese: 夏洛特發出一聲尖叫，用圍裙把面孔遮起來。

sentences.english: After you dusted cinders from your apron.
sentences.chinese: 在你拍去了圍裙上的炭灰之後。

sentences.english: She stood up and wiped her hands in the apron.
sentences.chinese: 她站起來，把她的雙手在圍裙上摸了摸。

sentences.english: She took the other one off and put it in her apron .
sentences.chinese: 她只好把另一隻脫下來，用圍裙細心包好。

sentences.english: Maria put her hand in her apron pocket.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗亞把手伸進圍裙的口袋。

sentences.english: Good dog, sit on this apron.
Amy uttered a scream, and hid her face in her apron.
sentences.chinese: 艾米發出一聲尖叫，用圍裙把面孔遮起來。

sentences.english: She stitched a pocket on the new apron.
sentences.chinese: 她在新圍裙上縫上一隻口袋。

sentences.english: In his right hand was the old apron.
sentences.chinese: 他的右手拿着那件舊圍裙。

definition: cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
